abstract.text: Request an encrypted embedded assertion for login types that require password encryption.

legalNotices.copyright: Copyright © 2025 Apple Inc. All rights reserved.

inlineContent.text: During authentication, if the SSO extension requests password encryption by setting the

in the login configuration, the system doesn’t send the password in the login request. Instead, it creates an encrypted embedded assertion instead, that contains the password. The assertion is a JSON Web Encryption (JWE) object that’s encrypted according to RFC 7516 Section 5.1 with JWE Compact Serialization. The supported key agreement algorithm is
per RFC 7518 Section 4.6. This algorithm is

, a proven-secure algorithm with the public keys included. See the Configure concatenation key derivation function (Concat KDF) section below for input values. Key agreement uses the public key for the
that’s supplied during registration. The supported encryption algorithm is
The following table specifies the header parameters that the system uses to create an encrypted embedded assertion:
Required. The supported encryption algorithm per RFC 7518 Section 4.6.
Required. The supported key agreement algorithm per RFC 7518 Section 5.3.
The ephemeral public key for the key exchange
Required. Per RFC 7518 Section 4.6.1.1, formatted per RFC 7517.
Required. Per RFC 7518 Section 4.6.1.3, the client uses the value from the request.
Optional. If present, adds key value pairs to the assertion.
The following table specifies the body parameters that the system uses to create an encrypted embedded assertion:
Required. The identity provider (IdP) needs to verify the value to ensure that the system created the assertion for them.
Required. The IdP needs to verify the value.
Required. The IdP needs to verify the value.
Required. If not set, the system uses the local account name.
Required. If not set, the system uses the local account name.
Required: If included, the IdP needs to verify that this value matches the nonce in the login request.
Required. The requested scope for the assertion. The default value is
and the system appends any additional ones to it. The default additional scope is
. This value needs to match the scope in the login request.
The value returned from the nonce request
Required: The key name is either the
Optional: If present, adds the key value pairs to the assertion.

content.text: Configure concatenation key derivation function (Concat KDF)

inlineContent.text: Configuration of Concat KDF for platform SSO is per RFC 7518 Section 4.6.2 and NIST.800-56A sections 5.8.1 and 6.2.2.2. See the input definitions in the table below. The system concatenates these values per NIST.800-56A sections 5.8.1 and then it computes a SHA-256 hash to create the key. Then, it sends the
values to the server in the header.
Set to the octets of the ASCII representation of the
Per RFC 7518 Section 4.6.2 when using direct key agreement
Set to the number of bits in the desired output key.

abstract.text: Make it easy for users to log into apps and services.
A set of extra scopes to add to the base for the authentication request.
The audience for validation and requests.
The name of the claim to include in authentication requests.
Use a system-supported method to authenticate with an identity provider.
Refresh a non-expired token instead of sending a new login request.
Request an embedded assertion for login types that require a digital signature for authentication.
Create a signed JOSE login request.
